isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY (MODEL RTLO-713)

note.para: Each mainshaft gear that has an I.D. snap ring must have its I.D. snap ring installed before placement on the mainshaft. Do not replace reverse gear I.D. snap ring.

Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with gear hub clutching teeth. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each mainshaft gear.

Axial clearance (end play) limits are .006" to .015" (0.15 to 0.4 mm) for all mainshaft gears. If the axial clearance is less than the minimum .006" tolerance, the limit washer should be replaced with a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the axial clearance is greater than the maximum .015" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed. This will decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

step1.para: With mainshaft pilot-end down, secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Install Roll Pin in Keyway

step1.para: If previously removed, install the roll pin in keyway ( Figure 168).
Position the 4th speed gear washer in the mainshaft 1st or bottom groove with washer flat side up. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Position 4th Speed Gear Washer in Mainshaft

step1.para: Start at the mainshaft bottom and install a plastic line in the keyway to lock the washer in place. As limit washers and gears are installed, continue to push the plastic line up ( Figure 169).
Position the 4th speed gear on the mainshaft with clutching teeth down ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Position 4th Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the flat washer ( Figure 170).
Install the 3rd speed gear with clutching teeth up and against the flat washer ( Figure 171)
Position the washer against the spacer with the washer flat side down. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 172).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 172).
Install the 2nd-3rd speed sliding clutch with the missing internal splines aligned with the plastic line ( Figure 173).
With the washer flat side up, position the 2nd speed gear limit washer in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 174).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 174).
Install 2nd gear spacer ( Figure 174).
With clutching teeth down, position the 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft engaging with spacer external splines ( Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Position 2nd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: With clutching teeth up, install 1st speed gear on the shaft against 2nd speed gear ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install 1st Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Position 1st speed gear spacer against 1st speed gear, engaging with spacer external splines with gear clutching teeth ( Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Position Limit Washer Against Spacer

step1.para: Position the limit washer against the spacer with the washer flat side down. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 177).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 177).
Insert a .006" feeler gauge and a .015" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 178). If out of tolerance, change the limit washer against the mainshaft spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 178. Insert Feeler Gauge Between Gear Hub and Mainshaft Spacer

step1.para: Align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 1st-reverse speed sliding clutch ( Figure 179).

figure.caption: Figure 179. Position Reverse Speed Gear Limit Washer in Groove

step1.para: With the flat side up, position the reverse speed gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 179).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 179).
Position the reverse speed gear spacer against the limit washer ( Figure 179).
Install reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the gear clutching teeth with spacer external splines and sliding clutch. Move the reverse gear down against the 1st speed gear ( Figure 180).

figure.caption: Figure 180. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the air line and insert the mainshaft key ( Figure 180and Figure 181).

note.para: Be careful not to move the gears while doing this procedure. The limit washers are unlocked and can rotate which would cause the gears to drop.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft from the vise ( Figure 182).

On the shaft front, align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch. Engage the sliding clutch external splines with the 4th speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 182).

note.para: Make sure reverse gear is against 1st speed gear, the mainshaft key is in the keyway, and the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch is engaged into 4th speed gear.
